adjective.description: (of a verb, especially in Latin or Greek) passive or middle in form but active in meaning.

noun.description: A person who makes a deposition or affidavit under oath.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin deponent- laying aside, putting down (in medieval Latin testifying), from the verb deponere, from de- down + ponere place. The use in grammar arose from the notion that the verb had laid aside the passive sense (although in fact these verbs were originally reflexive).
